detaileddescription.para: This method creates a new instance of the LoginHandler to handle a login request.

parameterdescription.para: The reply ID of the request from LoginApp.

detaileddescription.para: This method updates the statistics associated with a successful login.

memberdef.argsstring: (DBApp &dbApp, ServerLogOnParamsPtr pParams, const Mercury::Address &clientAddr, const Mercury::Address &replyAddr, Mercury::ReplyID replyID)
memberdef.name: LoginHandler

detaileddescription.para: The possible flows for this class are a bit complex, as it is a handler for a few different APIs. The rough flow is:

login() -> BillingSystem::getEntityKeyForAccount() Result is one of "Success", "Load From Username", "Create New" or "Failure": onGetEntityKeyForAccountSuccess() -> loadEntity() with a DBID onGetEntityKeyForAccountLoadFromUsername() -> loadEntity() with a username The Billing System indicates whether a failed load should trigger a new entity and whether such an entity should be remembered onGetEntityKeyForAccountCreateNew -> createNewEntity() The Billing System indicates whether the new entity should be remembered onGetEntityKeyForAccountFailure -> sendFailureReply()
sendFailureReply() -> DBApp::sendLogOnFailure and delete this

loadEntity() -> DBApp::getEntity -> onGetEntityCompleted() Before calling getEntity, a BaseAppMgr::createEntity::Request is started on our bundle. If we do not have a DBID, we hold the request object around to fill it in later.

onGetEntityCompleted() if okay -> checkOutEntity() If we have a request object, the DBID is filled out and the object deleted If the DB provided us a Base entity mailbox, store it onGetEntityCompleted() if create entity on load failure -> createNewEntity() onGetEntityCompleted() -> sendFailureReply()
checkOutEntity() if entity is already checked out or being checked out -> DBApp::onLogOnLoggedOnUser() and delete this checkOutEntity() -> DBApp::setBaseEntityLocation -> onReservedBaseMailBox()

createNewEntity() if not remembered -> sendCreateEntityMsg() If we have a request object, the DBID is filled out and the object deleted createNewEntity() -> DBApp::putEntity() -> onPutEntityComplete() Before calling either of the above, if no request object has been held, a BaseAppMgr::createEntity::Request is started on our bundle. If we do not have a DBID, we hold the request object around to fill it in later. A default set of entity attributes is then streamed onto our bundle

onPutEntityComplete() if failed -> onReservedBaseMailBox() (but still failed) If we have a request object, the DBID is filled out and the object deleted onPutEntityComplete() -> BillingSystem::setEntityKeyForAccount() If we have a request object, the DBID is filled out and the object deleted Result is either "Success" or Failure" onSetEntityKeyForAccountSuccess() -> sendCreateEntityMsg() onSetEntityKeyForAccountFailure() -> DBApp::delEntity() -> sendFailureReply()
onReservedBaseMailBox() if failed -> sendFailureReply() onReservedBaseMailBox() -> sendCreateEntityMsg()

sendCreateEntityMsg() -> handleMessage() sendCreateEntityMsg() -> handleException() sendCreateEntityMsg() -> handleShuttingDown() This sends the prepared BaseAppMgr::createEntity::Request to the BaseAppMgr
handleException() -> handleFailure()

handleMessage() if failure on BaseApp -> handleFailure() handleMessage() if we have no DBID -> sendReply() handleMessage() -> DBApp::setBaseEntityLocation() -> onSetBaseMailBox() The two success paths prepare a positive reply message for the login request
handleFailure() if we have no DBID -> sendReply() handleFailure() -> DBApp::clearBaseEntityLocation() -> onSetBaseMailBox() Firstly, a negative reply for the login request is prepared
onSetBaseMailBox() if success -> sendReply() onSetBaseMailBox() -> sendFailureReply()
sendReply() -> sends prepared reply for login request and delete this

So in the summary, after login() is called, the various callbacks should progress until one of the following is called, deleting the LoginHandler:
sendFailureReply()
checkOutEntity() for an Entity which is already checked out
sendReply() Constructor.

parameterdescription.para: The reply ID of the login request.

detaileddescription.para: This method returns the entity type name for our entity key.
Start the login process
Handles a failure to create entity base.
This function checks out the login entity. Must be called after entity has been successfully retrieved from the database.
This function creates a new login entity for the user.
This method loads the entity with the given key.
This method sends the completed BaseAppMgrInterface::createEntity::Request prepared in bundle_.
This method sends the reply to the LoginApp. Assumes bundle already has the right data.
This should also be the last thing this object is doing so this also destroys this object.
This method sends a failure reply to the LoginApp.
This should also be the last thing this object is doing so this also destroys this object.
